document.heading: PUBLIC ASSISTANCE FAIR HEARING PROCEDURES AMENDMENT ACT OF 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-55, the “Public Assistance Fair Hearing Procedures Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-257, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 1, 1997, and September 22, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 3, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-172 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-55 became effective on February 27, 1998.
